intro: Oreocharis fargesii, commonly known as the Farges' lily, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white and pink flowers with a distinctive purple-tipped corona. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often short and stout. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis fargesii is considered a species of conservation concern.
